answers.answer: Why don't you ask to get a CT scan of your liver and then you would be sure?  That is what they did to my sister who had liver cancer.
yeh i think they wil do that next , just thought would ask, do u think ultra sound can miss canver of the liver?

Technology has come so far that I am not sure about ultrasounds.  A CT scan, I believe, is a much more accurate imaging of organs.  Ultrasounds have been around for many, many years and were used on pregnant women to get images of the fetus, not to mention many other uses for them.  They sometimes couldn't tell the sex of the baby through an ultrasound or see other malformities so I would guess it would be possible for an ultrasound to miss a mass on the liver or any other organ if it didn't hit it right on.  I would just get the CT scan and go from there.
i hope they aint missed anything bad :(
if i had a mass on liver that cause dme to lose loads weight loads of ab pain, would my LFT liver funtion tests be really high? or can they stil be normal?

I would ask my doctor all of these questions.  I was told that if you lose 15% of your body weight within a 6 month period without doing anything to try to lose it (like exercise or diet) then it could be cancer or diabetes.  Have you been tested for diabetes?

yes ive been tested for diabetes and was nedative. the doctors are taking ages to do anything, ive had loads of tests. ive hadSigmoidoscopybarium mealbarium enemacamera down throatfull abdominal ultrasoundchest xrayab xrayblood testsall saying nothingim getting sick of it. i did lose that weight very fast over 10 days , lost like 3 stone, but in last 8 weeks ive gained 2 stone back, surly if it was cancer i wouldnt regain the weight?????????Also if the weight loss was because of cancer (weigth loss was 3/4 months ago) wouldnt i be on my back now??? if it was that servere???????????
doctors wont help you,buy antiparasitic herbs online and maybe a liver and kidney cleanse
